intro: Chelidurus ignotus, commonly known as the ghostly sea anemone, is a unique marine invertebrate belonging to the family Actinidiidae. It is characterized by its translucent, gelatinous body and long, delicate tentacles that extend from its central oral disc. This species is typically found in shallow coastal waters, where it attaches itself to rocky substrates using a basal disc. Its coloration is often pale or ghostly, helping it blend into its environment. Due to its elusive nature and limited study, much about its biology and ecological role remains unknown.
